3. **Enemy Safety**: The enemy is at (9,6) and can move up, down, or left. None of these directions threaten my current position, so no immediate collision risk.

4. **Long-Term Strategy**: Moving right toward (1,8) sets up a path to collect the apple at (1,7) in the next turn, growing my snake and increasing my score. This move keeps future options open and avoids dead ends.

Moving right is the safest and most strategic choice to progress toward an apple.

### Step 1: Evaluate All Moves for Immediate Danger
My snake’s head is (7,9) with body [(7,8), (7,7)] (full head-to-tail list: [(7,9), (7,8), (7,7)]). Enemy Snake #1’s head is (6,3) with body [(6,4)] (full list: [(6,3), (6,4)]). I eliminate deadly moves first:
- **UP**: Moves head to (7,10), which exceeds the y-coordinate max (9)—off the board. Deadly—eliminated.
- **DOWN**: Moves head to (7,8), the segment directly behind the head (own body). Moving backwards into own body is deadly—eliminated.
- **LEFT**: Moves head to (6,9). Check safety: Within board bounds, not own body (7,8; 7,7), not enemy body (6,4). Safe.
- **RIGHT**: Moves head to (8,9). Check safety: Within board bounds, not own/enemy body. Safe.

### Step 2: Rank Safe Moves by Criteria
Safe moves remaining: LEFT, RIGHT. I prioritize future options, proximity to reachable apples, and head-on collision avoidance (per [medium.com](https://medium.com/analytics-vidhya/playing-snake-with-ai-2ea68f0e914a) deterministic algorithm guidance and [gabrielgambetta.com](https://gabrielgambetta.com/astar-demystified.html) Manhattan distance heuristics):
- **Future Options**: Both moves offer 2 safe follow-up moves (LEFT to (6,9) has DOWN/LEFT; RIGHT to (8,9) has DOWN/RIGHT)—tied here.
- **Proximity to Reachable Apples**: The nearest apple is (4,6). Using Manhattan distance:
  - LEFT to (6,9): Distance = |6-4| + |9-6| = 5 (closer than current head’s 6)
  - RIGHT to (8,9): Distance = |8-4| + |9-6| = 7 (farther)
- **Head-On Collisions**: Enemy Snake #1’s safe moves (DOWN, LEFT, RIGHT) can’t reach (6,9) or (8,9) this turn (their head is at (6,3), 1-unit move limit)—no risk for either move.

LEFT is superior because it moves me closer to the nearest reachable apple.

### Long-Term Plan for Future Turns
1. After moving LEFT to (6,9), next turn prioritize moving DOWN to (6,8) to avoid trapping myself against the top edge (y=9) and continue closing in on the (4,6) apple.
2. Monitor Enemy Snake #1’s movements (they’re near lower apples (4,2) and (9,2))—avoid that area until their position clarifies to prevent indirect conflicts.
3. Use [github.com](https://github.com/darshanrk18/ai_snake) strict-safe food logic to verify post-eat survival before targeting the (4,6) apple.
4. After collecting (4,6), assess the next closest apple (likely (4,2)) while checking for loop risks (per Enemy Snake #1’s potential pathing).
